title: What are the responsibilities of students for their education? - Quora

response.answer_text: Health: Eat healthy food to stay fit and active.Physical activity: Involve in physical activity like brisk walk, table tennis, badminton, etc.Hygiene: One must keep oneself as well as surroundings clean and tidy. This is part of personal grooming.Be regular in your study. Fix the time and hours of study. The optimal period of continuous study is 2 hours. If you need to continue studying, take a break of around 10 minutes after every 2 hours.Behavior: Habits reflect in the behavior of a person. Inculcating good habits lead to good manners in a social environment.Emotional awareness: Recognizing and expressing feelings, empathy for others, ability to control impulses and coping with negative emotions.Communication: It is a critical skill that one should master for interpersonal relationships in personal and professional lives.Time Management: We all have 24 hours in a day. How we manage 24 hours determines what we achieve.Problem-solving: Identifying the problem, looking for possible solutions and choosing the best solution to solve the problem.Goals: Know how to set goals, and how to take action toward reaching those goals. Knowing how to track the progress is much more likely to stay motivated.Household Management: Assigning chores and regular household responsibilities can prepare for the working world.Cooking: Knowing how to get food or cook food is one of the skills to survive anywhere in the world.Finance: Know money management and budgeting. Know about the dangers of credit card debt and the importance of investing. These skills will have a great impact later on financial freedom.Help others. Helping someone enables teen to feel grateful for what he/she has. Volunteering for a social cause or practically assisting the needy people rises student’s self-confidence level.If the student has critical thinking, creativity, or imagination, let the student go after his/her passion, and achieve success. But ensure that the student not neglect the studies completely. For instance, Manu Bhaker, a 16 year old became the youngest Indian to win world cup gold in shooting.

Students, in an educational system, have two main roles. The first role is probably the most state-forward one. Students need to learn what the teachers are teaching. The duty of an educational system is to teach students about the various aspects of our world and the student is the one who needs to learn them. Students are also supposed to apply what they have learned in school in their lives. This creates meaning to the materials presented to the students. For example, someone taking art classes should not stop creating art after their art classes finish. They should continue to draw and apply the techniques and strategies of what they had learned in art class in their creations. A student’s role in an educational system is to learn about the subject and find ways to apply that learning for the betterment of themselves or to others.
